conclusion: Analyze the circuit step-by-step to determine voltage between points a and b when switch S is closed.
When switch S is open, the voltmeter reads 6V.
Voltage across the 10 Ω and 20 Ω resistors is 6V when S is open.
Current flows through 10 Ω and 20 Ω resistors in series when S is open.
Total resistance in the path is 30 Ω when S is open.
Use Ohm's Law to find total current with S open.
Current I = 0.2 A when S is open.
Voltage drop across 10 Ω is 2V and across 20 Ω is 4V.
Total voltage of the battery is 6V when S is open.
When S is closed, 10 Ω resistor is short-circuited.
Total resistance is 20 Ω + R when S is closed.
Total current I = 6V / (R + 20 Ω) when S is closed.
Voltage between points a and b is the same as across the 20 Ω resistor.
